firmware_notes: TNC-2 compatible. Usa firmware TAPR estándar 1.1.8/1.1.9. Modelos: MFJ-1270/B (básico), MFJ-1270C/1274C (256K EPROM expandible a 512K/1Mbit), MFJ-1274 añade indicador de sintonía LED. Versiones CT (-1270CT, -1274CT) incluyen modem 2400 baud integrado.

Connection.help:
Initiates an AX.25 connection to the specified station.

Examples:
  C DG2GSV
  C DB0UAL VIA DG2GSV
  C DB0FHN VIA DB0UAL,DB0RBS

The TNC sends SABM frames and waits for UA. If no response after RETRY attempts, connection fails.
Sends a DISC frame to end the current AX.25 connection gracefully.

Enters converse mode. Everything you type is packetized and transmitted.

Press Ctrl+C three times (with 1 second before/after) to return to command mode.

Enters transparent mode for binary data transfer.

All data passed without interpretation.
Use three Ctrl+C with timing to exit.

Monitoring.help:
Enables or disables the display of packets on the radio channel.

MON ON  – show monitored traffic
MON OFF – only show data from connected station

Default: ON

When ON, monitors all packets regardless of destination.

Default: ON

When ON, only shows packets from stations you're connected to.

Default: OFF

Controls whether monitored traffic is shown during active connections.

Default: OFF

When ON, shows digipeated packets.

Default: OFF

When ON, displays packet header on separate line from data.

Default: ON
Displays a list of stations heard recently with timestamps.

Sets screen width for word wrap.

Values: 0-255 (0 = disabled)
Default: 0

Station Setup.help:
Sets the callsign used for all transmissions.

Examples:
  MY EA7HQL
  MY EA7HQL-5

SSID (-0 to -15) can be appended. Default SSID is -0.

You MUST set this before connecting.

Sets alternate identifier for digipeating.

Example: MYALIAS MADRID

Stations can digipeat via MYCALL or MYALIAS.

Default: none

Controls whether the TNC echoes back characters you type.

ECHO ON  – TNC echoes input
ECHO OFF – no echo (use if terminal has local echo)

Default: ON

Adds LF after each CR received from computer.

Default: OFF

Enables XON/XOFF software flow control between TNC and terminal.

Default: ON

When ON, displays message when entering/exiting modes.

Default: ON

Packet Timing.help:
Delay between keying TX and sending data.

Values: 0-120 (10ms units)
Default: 30 (300ms)

Guidelines:
  Direct VHF: 20-30
  Via repeater: 40-60
  HF: 30-50

Seconds to wait for ACK before retransmitting.

Values: 1-15
Default: 3

Guidelines:
  VHF direct: 3
  Via digipeater: 5-7
  HF: 8-15

Max retransmission attempts before disconnect.

Values: 0-15
Default: 10

CSMA persistence. Higher = more aggressive transmit.

Values: 0-255
Default: 63

Probability = (PERSIST + 1) / 256

Time interval between PERSIST checks.

Values: 0-255 (10ms units)
Default: 10 (100ms)

Time slots to wait after DCD drops before transmitting.

Values: 0-255
Default: 0

Delay before responding to poll.

Values: 0-250
Default: 0

Extra TXDELAY when transmitting through repeater.

Values: 0-255
Default: 0

Repeater tail hang time.

Values: 0-255
Default: 0

Packet Advanced.help:
Maximum data bytes per AX.25 I-frame.

Values: 0-255 (0 = 256)
Default: 128

Guidelines:
  HF (300 baud): 40-80
  VHF (1200 baud): 128
  VHF (9600 baud): 255

Max unacknowledged I-frames before waiting for ACK.

Values: 1-7
Default: 4

Time with no activity before sending link check.

Values: 0-250 (0=disabled)
Default: 30

ON - use AX.25 v2.0 protocol
OFF - use AX.25 v1.0

Recommended ON for VHF/UHF.

Default: ON

Enables digipeater function for MYCALL and MYALIAS.

Default: ON

When ON, passes packets with CRC errors.

Default: OFF

ON - PERSIST/SLOTTIME method
OFF - DWAIT method

Default: ON

Beacon & Unproto.help:
Sets beacon transmission:

EVERY n - every n×10 seconds
AFTER n - once after n×10 sec inactivity

Values: 0-250 (0 = off)
Default: EVERY 0

Example: BEACON EVERY 90 (every 15 min)

Use beacons sparingly!

Sets beacon text. Max 128 characters.

Example: BTEXT EA7HQL VHF Packet

Clear with: BTEXT % or BTEXT &

Default: empty

Sets destination and path for UI frames.

Examples:
  UNPROTO CQ
  UNPROTO BEACON VIA WIDE2-2
  UNPROTO APRS VIA RELAY,WIDE

Default: CQ

Immediately sends identification packet.

Useful for final ID before shutdown.

When ON, sends ID beacon every 9.5 minutes when digipeating.

Default: OFF

Connect Messages.help:
Message sent when someone connects. Max 128 characters.

Example: CTEXT Welcome to EA7HQL

Default: empty

When ON, sends CTEXT automatically.

Default: OFF

When ON, displays '*** CONNECTED to' message.

Default: ON

Mode to enter after connection:

CONVERSE or TRANS

Default: CONVERSE

When ON, stays in converse after disconnect.

Default: OFF

Packet Timing Control.help:
Send packet after n×100ms of inactivity.

Values: 0-250
Default: AFTER 10 (1 second)

When ON, PACTIME applies in converse.

Default: ON

Character that forces packet transmission.

Default: $0D (CR)

Example: SENDPAC $05

ON - CR added to data
OFF - CR stripped

Default: ON

Serial Port.help:
Data bits for serial port.

Values: 7, 8
Default: 7

Set to 8 for 8N1 with 8BITCONV ON.

Allows 8-bit characters.

Requires AWLEN 8.

Default: OFF

Sets parity:

0 - None
1 - Odd  
2 - Even

Default: 2 (Even)

Note: Set to 0 for Host/KISS mode.

Software flow control.

Same as FLOW.

Default: ON

TNC honors computer flow control.

Default: ON

XON character for flow control.

Default: $11 (Ctrl+Q)

XOFF character for flow control.

Default: $13 (Ctrl+S)

Special Characters.help:
Character that cancels current line.

Default: $18 (Ctrl+X)

Toggles packet output to bit bucket.

Default: $19 (Ctrl+Y)

Character to exit transparent mode.

Default: $03 (Ctrl+C)

Requires three chars with CMDTIME spacing.

Guard time for transparent mode escape.

Values: 0-255
Default: 1

0 = only BREAK exits.

ON - backspace (destructive)
OFF - \ character

Default: ON

MFJ-Specific.help:
Redefines STA and CON LED functions on MFJ-1274.

Allows customization of front panel LED indicators.

Consult manual for specific options.

Enters modem calibration routine.

Commands in calibration:
  <SPACE> - toggle between mark/space tones
  D - dual tones (both mark and space)
  Any key - exit

Use for adjusting TX audio levels.

Note: Can disable timeout timer with JMP4 jumper during calibration.

Display.help:
Shows TNC parameter values.

No parameter - all settings
With parameter - single setting

Examples:
  DISP
  DISP PACLEN

Enables JHOST binary protocol.

WARNING: Binary mode. Use only with JHOST software.

Default: OFF

Enables KISS protocol.

Requires RESTART to activate.
Set CONMODE TRANS and PARITY 0 first.

Default: OFF

Reset & Restart.help:
Resets ALL parameters to factory defaults.

WARNING: Erases callsign and all settings.

Restarts TNC without clearing parameters.

Required after KISS mode changes.

Special Keys.help:
Three Ctrl+C with proper timing return to cmd: prompt.

Timing: silence CMDTIME, 3×Ctrl+C within CMDTIME, silence CMDTIME.
Toggles TNC output to bit bucket (CANPAC).

Sends serial BREAK.

Uses: autobaud, exit transparent if CMDTIME=0.

connectors.Computer Port (RS-232): DB-25 male (DTE). Pin 2: TxD (from computer), Pin 3: RxD (to computer), Pin 4: RTS, Pin 5: CTS, Pin 6: DSR, Pin 7: GND, Pin 8: DCD, Pin 20: DTR. Standard RS-232C.
connectors.Computer Port (TTL): 8-pin IDC header. Alternative TTL connection. Pin 1: GND, Pin 2: TxD (out), Pin 3: RxD (in), Pin 4: RTS, Pin 5: CTS, Pin 6: +5V, Pin 7: DCD, Pin 8: DTR.
connectors.Radio Port: 5-pin DIN 180° female. Pin 1: RX audio in (~100mV-1V p-p), Pin 2: Ground, Pin 3: PTT out (active low, open collector), Pin 4: TX audio out (AFSK, adjustable), Pin 5: Ground.
connectors.Speaker: 3.5mm mono jack (rear panel). Monitor output for both TX and RX audio. Not an input.
connectors.Modem Disconnect: 2-pin header. Short for internal modem. Open for external modem.
connectors.2400/9600 Modem: 20-pin header for optional high-speed modem boards (MFJ-2400, MFJ-9600). Pre-installed on CT models.
connectors.Power: 2-pin Molex or 2.1mm coax, center positive. +12V DC nominal (9-15V), ~200mA typical, ~350mA peak.
connectors.Battery Backup: CR2032 lithium battery socket. Maintains settings during power loss.

notes.model_differences: MFJ-1270: Basic model. MFJ-1270B: Improved version. MFJ-1270C/1274C: 256K EPROM (expandible to 512K/1Mbit), enhanced features. MFJ-1274: Adds front panel tuning indicator LEDs. MFJ-1270CT/1274CT: Include integrated 2400 baud modem.
notes.tuning_indicator: MFJ-1274 models have LED tuning indicator on front panel. Center LEDs (1-2) light when tuned to ~1700 Hz. Left LEDs = lower frequency, right LEDs = higher frequency.
notes.vhf_hf_switch: Rear panel VHF/HF switch selects modem tones and baud rate. VHF (out): 1200 baud, 1200/2200 Hz. HF (in): 300 baud, 1600/1800 Hz (some manuals say 2125/2295 Hz).
notes.modem_calibration: Internal potentiometers for tone adjustment. VHF: R79 (RX level), R78 (low tone 1200Hz), R77 (high tone 2200Hz), R76 (TX level). HF (1270C): R113 (RX level), R106 (low 1600Hz), R105 (high 1800Hz). Access through top cover.
notes.ram_expansion: 1270C/1274C support mailbox RAM expansion. MFJ-45C (128K) or MFJ-512K (512K) RAM chips available. Increases mailbox capacity.
notes.optional_modems: MFJ-2400 (2400 baud packet modem), MFJ-9600 (9600 baud G3RUH modem). Install in 20-pin header. Pre-installed on CT models.
notes.firmware: Uses TAPR-compatible firmware. Standard is 256K EPROM, expandible to 512K or 1Mbit. Compatible with TheNet X1J4, G8BPQ, and other TNC-2 firmware.
notes.timeout_timer: Hardware timeout timer can be disabled by shorting JMP4 (jumper near RS-232). Useful during calibration. Remove for normal operation.
notes.tnc2_compatible: Fully TNC-2 compatible. All TAPR TNC-2 commands supported. Can use TNC-2 replacement EPROMs and firmware.
notes.starter_packs: MFJ offered starter packs with cables and software. MFJ-1282 (C64), MFJ-1283 (C64 tape), MFJ-1284 (IBM), MFJ-1287 (Macintosh), MFJ-1290 (Amiga).
notes.power_consumption: ~200mA @ 12V typical (2.4W). ~350mA peak during TX. CR2032 battery maintains settings during power off.
notes.history: Introduced mid-1980s. Based on TAPR TNC-2 design. MFJ-1270B became very popular in late 1980s/early 1990s. Still widely used in APRS and emergency communications. Production continued through 2000s with C models.
